sen.e: A 假 (ke or ka) was a holiday given to nobles and government officials under the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 中国においては、漢から南北朝時代_(中国)には「休沐」と称して5日に1日、唐では10日に1日が休日となる旬假が一般的であったが、日本においてはもう少し多かった。
sen.e: In China from the Han period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts one holiday (called a "kyumoku") in every five days was given, in the Tang period generally one holiday (called a shunka) in every ten days, however, in Japan there were a little more holidays.
